title: Ricochet Hell
awards: Placed 2nd in the 2016 Stony Brook University Game Competition
tech: Work in progress game started as an exercise to learn the Unity game engine, written in C#

title: Muse
tech: Architected and deployed a scalable multitiered solution using Ansible, Node.JS, Socket IO, nginx, and etcd service discovery

title: OS Functionality
description: Added functionality to a emulated MIPS OS
tech: Implemented virtual memory with demand paging, many syscalls (ex. exec, fork, join), multilevel feedback scheduling, console, and file system

title: Dr. Bill's Jewel Heist
awards: Finalist in the 2015 Stony Brook University Game Competition
description: Avoid the lasers and find the jewels
tech: Developed theme & all assets. Integrated SFML Audio & Box2D into game engine, added debug options, custom map importer, controller functionality, and memory management

title: Journey Through Europe
tech: Used JavaFX GUI, styled using CSS, external XML for data, and implemented Dijkstra's algorthim for AI
